comments:

What VM are you using? If you download and reinstall Eclipse, does the problem still occur. Moving to Runtime since they handle class loading.

(In reply to comment #1)
> What VM are you using? 

java version "1.4.2"
gij (GNU libgcj) version 4.1.2 20060729 (prerelease) (Debian 4.1.1-10)

> If you download and reinstall Eclipse, does the problem
> still occur.

This happened under fresh downloads of both the 3.2 and 3.3 tar.gz eclipse packages.

AAron, GCJ is not an officially supported VM. In order to get that tracked down, I would enter a bug against GCJ with steps to reproduce the problem.
Closing for now.

I moved over to:

java version "1.5.0_08"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_08-b03)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_08-b03, mixed mode, sharing)

Everything appears to be working.  Thanks for your help.
